text.p: -- Salomon Bros anaylst Michael Sargent said in a research note he reinitiated coverage of Crompton & Knowles Corp with a strong buy recommendation.
-- Shares were up 5/8 to 17-3/4 in midsession New York Stock Exchange trade.
-- The intermediate-term price target is $23 per share and the longer-term target is "in excess of $30," Sargent wrote.

-- "In our view, the new Crompton & Knowles (after a merger with Uniroyal Chemical Corp) has the financial and operational leverage to generate greater than 20 percent compounded earnings-per-share growth for the next several years. 1997 should be a transition year for the company as CEO Vince Calarco puts strict cost reduction and incentive programs in place. By 1998, the company's strategic options broaden, as asset sale restrictions resulting from pooling accounting are lifted, and the majority of the company's debt is callable," the analyst said.
